org.csiro.darjeeling.infuser.bytecode
Class BCELInstructionAdapter

java.lang.Object
  org.csiro.darjeeling.infuser.bytecode.BCELInstructionAdapter

public class BCELInstructionAdapter
extends java.lang.Object

Adapter that converts BCEL instructions to corresponding Darjeeling instructions. Note that there are some instructions, such as stack manipulation instructions, that act as placeholders and that will be converted to their final form during bytecode transformation.

The first phase conversion from Java bytecode to Darjeeling bytecode, each method implementation in a class file is parsed by BCEL and the instructions are then converted to corresponding Darjeeling instructions by a BCELInstructionAdapter and put into a CodeBlock object. Since the generated Instruction objects are context sensitive in terms of both the Infusion and CodeBlock they are in, a new adapter has to be constructed for each CodeBlock that is created.

Author:
Niels Brouwers

BCELInstructionAdapter

public BCELInstructionAdapter(InternalInfusion infusion,
                              org.apache.bcel.generic.ConstantPoolGen constantPoolGen,
                              CodeBlock codeBlock)
Parameters:
infusion - InternalInfusion that will contain the generated instructions.
constantPoolGen - BCEL ConstantPoolGen object needed for resolving things like method and class names, signatures etc
codeBlock - the CodeBlock object that the generated instructions will belong to. This is needed for establishing direct links to LocalVariable objects in the code blocks.
